messages: 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:18): So is anyone going to write a counter-proposal for "keep microdata in the main spec"?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:18): deadline is in 2 days
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:18): what happens if we don't?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:18): or I can extend it if anyone volunteers to do it and names a specific deadline
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:19): chairs will likely post a CfC resolution to split it out
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:19): won't that just be forced to a vote?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:19): has not read any of the process documents
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:20): do you think a counter-proposal is likely to change the outcome of the chairs' decision?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:22): and can we expect that the chairs will provide actual arguments for the decision?
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:26): If necessary, I volunteer for it.  But I'd like to see the answers to 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342's questions too.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:27): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: if the CfC draws no objections, it will stand
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:27): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: but it will, and then what?

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:28): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: if there are objections that do not have rationale, or have only weak rationale, then we will decide based on which position has the stronger rationale if that seems clear
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:28): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: voting would be a last resort if the arguments on both sides seem well-balanced
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:29): ok, so basically the end result is going to be a vote, because neither side is going to give up

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:29): I think if there is a good rationale for keeping it in, it's worth writing it up now rather than expressing it piecemeal as objections to a consensus resolution

fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (23:29): so what's the difference between emailing rationale for keeping microdata in the spec before the deadline as a counter-proposal vs. afterwards as a CfC objection?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:31): one possible difference is that if you plan ahead, you may come up with something more coherent

4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:31): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: while we're on the topic, what's the practical difference between an issue getting no change proposals, and an issue getting one change proposal requesting the status quo?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:32): another possible difference is that it may be more persuasive to observers to write something up front than to object at the last minute
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:32): this process isn't very spam-proof if it forces people to do lots of work to fend off any proposal
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:32): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: getting no change proposals, it would be closed without prejudice

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:33): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: getting one requesting the status quo would keep the issue open, and may result in that Change Proposal getting adopted, unless its existence motivates somebody to write one requesting an actual change

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:33): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: if a status quo Change Proposal does get adopted though, then it would be a decision of the working group and not merely a closed-without-prejudice situation
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:33): i.e. at that point the issue would be closed with prejudice

4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:34): so if an issue is not getting any change proposals it's better to wait til the last minute and then submit a status-quo change proposal than to not do anything, because that would automatically force a decision to keep the spec as is?

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:34): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: I think the chairs will review quality of Change Proposals before insisting on replies - I think the requirement to do a significant chunk of writing is a sufficient spam deterrent
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:34): (assuming one supports the status quo)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:35): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: once an issue has a Change Proposal, it stays open until the chairs take some action, with no specific deadline
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:35): so what's the dec 2 deadline about for microdata?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:35): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: so doing that would extend the deadline for anyone else to write a different Change Proposal
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:36): man i miss the days of not having the w3c involved in html5
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:36): hypothetically, if the RDFa crowd have their way and get microdata removed, I trust the WHATWG would ignore it and keep it in our version of the spec?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:36): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: in that case, the chairs have stated an intent to move on if we don't get any alternate proposals by that date
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:37): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: it'd be in the complete.html file, for sure
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:37): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: it'd probably not be in html5 unless the w3c versin of html5 starts deviating too much from sanity

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:37): I think the W3C would be happy to publish it as a separate spec (afaik no one has objected to that, not even the TAG), and the WHATWG would be welcome to keep it in the WHATWG copy of the HTML5 main spec if that is their preference
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:38): dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806, 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317, are either you interested in investing some time writing a counter-proposal?
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:39): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: Yeah, I'll write one.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:39): I can certainly spend some time too, but if you take ownership of the action (or whatever) that'd be great

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:39): my personal expectation is that if it gets split, the browser bits will still get implemented (I certainly want to see it in WebKit) and the default mode of the validator would likely be HTML+SVG+MathML+Microdata
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:40): are there any other specs which add elements/attributes on top of HTML5 except RDFa?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:40): there's the proposed profile spec, though that has not made it to FPWD yet
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:40): it seems quite a strange way to write specs
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:41): HTML5 explicitly allows other specs to add elements and attributes
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:41): yes I know
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:41): but so far nothing stable does?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:41): what counts as "stable"?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:42): a truly stable spec could not depend on HTML5 yet
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:42): if the bar is FPWD, then RDFa is the only example I know of
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:42): anything except specs that exist only because the feature was rejected from HTML5
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:44): arguably SVG and MathML also define elements and attributes that extend HTML5, albeit somewhat involuntarily
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:44): (since HTML5 doesn't define the valid set of elements for those languages)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:44): dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806: so you'll write a full proposal before dec 2 or just take the action to extend the deadline?
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:44): Write a full proposal.
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:45): Since I just want to keep the status quo, nothing complex is necessary.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:45): mind if I have a look when you're done and leave feedback?
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:45): I'll write it tonight and email you.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:45): most of what you'd need to do is to collect and organize the rationale

4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (23:45): personally i think everything should be in html5 if we think it's good, including microdata and rdfa and profile="" and version=""... i just don't think rdfa, profile="", and version="" are good. :-)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:46): should we spend time rebutting the points made by the other proposal?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:46): tries to find the proposal
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:46): that would be useful information, sure
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:46): I don't think we need to do so directly, though certainly pointing our rationales in those directions would be good.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:46): certainly
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:47): you don't have to make it point-counterpoint but if you feel it makes any strong arguments for which you have a rebuttal, then it would be good to say so
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:47): btw http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2009Oct/0773.html
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:48): and earlier thread here: http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2009Oct/0420.html
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:48): (that thread included a number of arguments both pro and con)
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:48): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: what mail client do you use to keep organized?
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:49): can't ever find anything that fast
dddbb966009bf3f66ba0270cc9762806 (23:49): I suspect he's got a listing of issues.  ^_^
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (23:49): clever, you!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:55): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: I use Mail.app, the search is pretty good
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:55): but I also made an organized issues list
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:56): http://dev.w3.org/html5/status/issue-status.html
